body.name: HGST Ultrastar He10 10TB SATA 6Gb/s 7200 RPM 256MB Cache 3.5-Inch Enterprise Hard Drive (HUH721010ALE604) (Renewed)
features: Power disable feature, adapter cable included for legacy systems
Performance -Enterprise-grade internal HDD with 10 TB of capacity, 7200 RPM spindle speed
Quality Packaging -Packed and shipped in pressure rated box to ensure no damage when shipping
Helium Technology -HelioSeal for lower vibration and longer lifespan compared to air-filled drives
body.description: Designed to handle workloads up to 550TB per year, the Ultrastar DC HC510 uses PMR technology and is the industry’s first 10TB drive that is drop-in ready for any enterprise capacity application or environment. Based on field proven, third-generation HelioSeal technology, it offers one of the lowest power profiles in the industry to help data center architects meet eco-environmental goals and requirements.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #179 in Amazon Renewed (See Top 100 in Amazon Renewed) #12 in Internal Hard Drives #43 in Renewed Computers & Accessories

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect drives for your storage server or NAS
reviews.reviewText: Couldn't be happier with those drives. They came refurbished but in excellent condition. No worries or complaints there and I tested them extensively. They have been happy humming for a couple of months now and still, no issues whatsoever. Very fast, nice cache, reliable and quiet. The only irritation I have with them is that updating firmware is almost impossible. Not that there is any urgent need to do so, I just like to keep all my hardware on updated firmware and those drives make it even more user-unfriendly than it usually is with the Enterprise level drives. So it is just my quirk and a personal irritation with them - it doesn't reflect on well-deserved flying marks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy. Note power disable workaround.
reviews.reviewText: Burned about 10 TB to the drive within two days of receiving. SMART data looks great. No issues and drive was very quiet. Note that there was no 'adapter" cable or tape to bypass the drive power disable feature supplied. I anticipated this and had a SATA power extender available with the fifth wire severed. I used the extender so I wouldn't have to cut the "nicer" cable that came with the power supply.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn't be more satisfied
reviews.reviewText: Price, quality and storage space are just unbeatable. Will order one when I need it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well so far
reviews.reviewText: Ordered 3 of them. all have spun up and are working well ,with molex connectors, inside my server. The make some small noise but its not all that noticeable to me. Just ordered 2 more hoping for more of the same.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far is working well. If using externally, may not work with all usb adapters
reviews.reviewText: So initially to test this drive i had connected it to one of those 'cord only' type of usb adapters, specifically mine is a Vantec CB-ISATAU2 SATA/IDE to USB 2.0 Adapter. It would work ok (you do have to first open up Disk Management in windows and setup the volume, format the drive, not a hard process but just as fyi it is not pre-formatted). you can do a very quick google on how to to that process again, its just a couple of clicks.so with this usb adapter i would find that sometimes the drive would be unavailable and would be difficult to get it to be recognized. This had me worried there was something wrong with the drive. But i also had a USB hard drive enclosure, an Inateck 3.5 Inch HDD Enclosure, USB 3.0 and with this device i've so far not had any issue.as with any drive old, new, refurbed, you can always get a lemon. as long as the company supports you with refund/replacement then the value seems pretty good - just remember redundancy is key for important data (i.e. backup to multiple places but local and cloud etc if possible)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: dont waste your money or time, both ones I bought died within a week of each other, only lasted about 2 weeks at most .. worse garbage I've ever seen. its like they put a band aide on it to sell it just for it to go out again tried 2 different computers, even a brand new docking station,,sometimes it will spin up but wont initialize others just drops power on it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Value for money. Recommended for advanced users
reviews.reviewText: The disk arrived without problems, the SMART values are healthy, I completely formatted the disk and it is very fast. I recommend that those who use this disk be advanced users who know about this, because otherwise you could mistakenly think that the disk is defective, but if you do not know how to configure or use it, it will not work as you want.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have had absolutely no trouble from any of the several I have purchased. I have them installed in an HP Z840 workstation and can barely hear any drive/fan noise not enough to be of any concern. These are great for my drone video storage.
